artefact.overview: You need approval from the Chemicals Regulation Directorate (CRD) to sell, distribute or store new pesticides in the UK
artefact.licence_short_description: Approval from the Chemicals Regulation Directorate (CRD) to sell, distribute or store new pesticides in the UK.
artefact.licence_overview:
All products used for the protection of plants in agriculture, horticulture, forestry, industrial or amenity situations, and home gardens must be authorised by the [Chemicals Regulation Directorate (CRD),](http://www.pesticides.gov.uk/guidance/industries/pesticides "Chemicals Regulation Directorate (CRD)"){:rel="external"} of the Health and Safety Executive, before they can be sold, distributed, stored or used in the UK.  This includes imported products.

Plant protection products (PPPs) may be used to control fungi, bacteria, viruses, insects, weeds, molluscs and any other 'pest' that would be harmful to crops or garden plants. Weed killers used on hard surfaces to control weeds are also included. 

Active substances used in PPPs may include micro-organisms (such as bacteria or nematodes) or plant extracts which are classed as biopesticides, as well as chemically manufactured compounds.

For further information about the legislation affecting PPPs, or applying for authorisation of a PPP, or to check what products are authorised for use:

$C
**Chemicals Regulation Directorate**  
[www.pesticides.gov.uk](http://www.pesticides.gov.uk "Chemicals Regulation Directorate"){:rel="external"}  
**Telephone:** 01904 455 775 
$C

*[PPPs]: Plant protection products
